name: Conditions A to Z
description: Find out about health conditions, including their symptoms and how they're treated.

significantLink.description: Acanthosis nigricans is the term for darkened, thickened patches of skin in the armpit and around the groin and neck. Find out about the main causes and treatments.
significantLink.name: Acanthosis nigricans

significantLink.description: Read about achalasia, a disorder of the gullet (oesophagus) where it loses the ability to move food along. The valve at the end of the gullet also fails to open.
significantLink.name: Achalasia

significantLink.description: Find out about acid and chemical burns including what causes them, where to get help, how to do first aid, and how they're treated.
significantLink.name: Acid and chemical burns

significantLink.description: An acoustic neuroma is a type of non-cancerous (benign) brain tumour. Find out about the symptoms, treatments and outlook for this condition.
significantLink.name: Acoustic neuroma (vestibular schwannoma)

significantLink.description: Find out about acromegaly, the abnormal growth of hands, feet and other body parts. This includes the symptoms, when to get medical help and how it's treated.
significantLink.name: Acromegaly

significantLink.description: Find out more about actinic keratoses, which are patches of skin that have been damaged by the sun.
significantLink.name: Actinic keratoses (solar keratoses)

significantLink.description: Read about acute cholecystitis, which is inflammation of the gallbladder. It usually occurs when a gallstone blocks the cystic duct.
significantLink.name: Acute cholecystitis

significantLink.description: Acute kidney injury (AKI) is sudden damage to the kidneys that causes them to not work properly. It can range from minor loss of kidney function to complete kidney failure.
significantLink.name: Acute kidney injury

significantLink.description: Find out about acute respiratory distress syndrome, including who’s at risk of getting it, the symptoms, how it’s treated and what causes it.
significantLink.name: Acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS)

significantLink.description: Find out about alcohol poisoning, what the symptoms are, what to do if you think you or someone else has it, what the treatments are and what causes it.
significantLink.name: Alcohol poisoning

significantLink.description: Read about alkaptonuria, or "black urine disease", a rare inherited disorder that can turn urine and parts of the body a dark colour and lead to other problems.
significantLink.name: Alkaptonuria

significantLink.description: Find out about amyloidosis, including what the symptoms are, when and where to get medical help, the causes and how it's treated.
significantLink.name: Amyloidosis

significantLink.description: Read about anabolic steroids, which are prescription-only medicines that are sometimes taken without medical advice to increase muscle mass and improve athletic performance.
significantLink.name: Anabolic steroid misuse

significantLink.description: Read about Angelman syndrome, a genetic disorder that affects the nervous system and causes severe physical and intellectual disability
significantLink.name: Angelman syndrome

significantLink.description: Find out what to do if you’ve been bitten by an animal or person, including first aid advice, when to get medical help and what treatment you may need.
significantLink.name: Animal and human bites

significantLink.description: Asbestosis is a serious lung condition caused by exposure to asbestos – a building material used mostly from the 1950s to the 1990s.
significantLink.name: Asbestosis

significantLink.description: Find out more about atherosclerosis, what the symptoms are, how you can help stop it getting worse, how it's treated and what causes it.
significantLink.name: Atherosclerosis

significantLink.description: Read about athlete's foot, a common fungal infection of the foot. Find out about the symptoms, what causes it, and how it's treated.
significantLink.name: Athlete's foot

significantLink.description: Find out about auditory processing disorder, a condition where you have difficulty understanding sounds including spoken words.
significantLink.name: Auditory processing disorder (APD)

significantLink.description: Find out about abdominal aortic aneurysm, what the symptoms are, how it’s treated, how to lower your risk of getting one and what the causes are.
significantLink.name: Abdominal aortic aneurysm

significantLink.description: Acne is a common skin condition that affects most people at some point. It causes spots, oily skin and sometimes skin that's hot or painful to touch.
significantLink.name: Acne

significantLink.description: Find out about actinomycosis, including how you get it, what the symptoms are, how it's treated and how to reduce your risk of getting it.
significantLink.name: Actinomycosis

significantLink.description: Read about acute myeloid leukaemia (AML), an aggressive cancer of the myeloid cells. Information about signs and symptoms, causes, diagnosis and treatment.
significantLink.name: Acute myeloid leukaemia

significantLink.description: Acute pancreatitis is a serious condition where the pancreas becomes inflamed over a short period of time.
significantLink.name: Acute pancreatitis

significantLink.description: Addison's disease, also known as primary adrenal insufficiency or hypoadrenalism, is a rare disorder of the adrenal glands.
significantLink.name: Addison's disease

significantLink.description: Albinism is an inherited condition that affects the production of melanin, the pigment that colours the skin, hair and eyes.
significantLink.name: Albinism

significantLink.description: Alcohol misuse is where a person consumes excessive amounts of alcoholic drinks.
significantLink.name: Alcohol misuse

significantLink.description: Alcohol-related liver disease (ARLD) refers to liver damage caused by excess alcohol intake. There are several stages of severity and a range of associated symptoms.
significantLink.name: Alcohol-related liver disease

significantLink.description: Find out about allergic rhinitis, including what the symptoms are, what you can do about it and when to get medical help.
significantLink.name: Allergic rhinitis

significantLink.description: Find out about allergies, including typical symptoms, common allergies, when to get emergency medical help and allergy testing and treatments.
significantLink.name: Allergies

significantLink.description: NHS information about altitude sickness, including symptoms, treatment and how to prevent it.
significantLink.name: Altitude sickness

significantLink.description: Alzheimer's disease is the most common cause of dementia. Dementia is a group of symptoms associated with a decline in the way your brain functions, affecting your memory and the way you behave.
significantLink.name: Alzheimer's disease

significantLink.description: Read about amniocentesis, a diagnostic test carried out during pregnancy to assess whether your baby could develop a genetic or chromosomal condition.
significantLink.name: Amniocentesis

significantLink.description: Read about anal fissures and the importance of seeing a GP. Also, read about the symptoms, causes, treatment and prevention of anal fissures.
significantLink.name: Anal fissure

significantLink.description: Find out what an anal fistula is, including information about the symptoms, causes and treatments.
significantLink.name: Anal fistula

significantLink.description: NHS information about anaphylaxis, including symptoms, when to get help, treatment and prevention.
significantLink.name: Anaphylaxis

significantLink.description: Find out about androgen insensitivity syndrome (AIS), a rare condition that affects the development of a person's genitals and reproductive organs.
significantLink.name: Androgen insensitivity syndrome

significantLink.description: Find out about angina, a type of chest pain caused by the heart not getting enough blood. Find out about the symptoms and how it's treated.
significantLink.name: Angina

significantLink.description: Find out what angioedema is, what the symptoms are, why it happens and how it's treated.
significantLink.name: Angioedema

significantLink.description: Read about ankylosing spondylitis (AS) and other types of axial spondyloarthritis, a long-term (chronic) condition in which the spine and other areas of the body become inflamed.
significantLink.name: Ankylosing spondylitis

significantLink.description: Antiphospholipid syndrome (APS), also known as Hughes syndrome, is a disorder of the immune system that causes an increased risk of blood clots.
significantLink.name: Antiphospholipid syndrome (APS)

significantLink.description: Aphasia is a condition that affects how you communicate. It can make it hard to speak, understand others, read, write and use numbers. Find out about the symptoms, treatment and what causes it.
significantLink.name: Aphasia

significantLink.description: Find out about appendicitis, including what the symptoms are, what to do if you think you have it, how it's treated and possible complications.
significantLink.name: Appendicitis

significantLink.description: Read about arthritis, a common condition that causes pain and inflammation in a joint. Although there's no cure, treatment can help slow it down.
significantLink.name: Arthritis

significantLink.description: Find out more about aspergillosis, the name of a group of conditions caused by a mould called aspergillus.
significantLink.name: Aspergillosis

significantLink.description: Find out about asthma, a common condition that affects breathing, including the symptoms, treatment and how it affects your life.
significantLink.name: Asthma

significantLink.description: Find out more about astigmatism, a common eye condition, including the symptoms and how it's treated.
significantLink.name: Astigmatism

significantLink.description: Ataxia is the term for a group of disorders that affect co-ordination, balance and speech. Find out about the main types, what causes them, and how they're treated.
significantLink.name: Ataxia

significantLink.description: Find out about atrial fibrillation, a condition that causes an irregular heart rhythm, including symptoms, treatment and how it affects your life.
significantLink.name: Atrial fibrillation

significantLink.description: Find out about autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease (ADPKD), an inherited condition that causes small fluid-filled sacs called cysts to develop in the kidneys.
significantLink.name: Autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease

significantLink.description: Autosomal recessive polycystic kidney disease (ARPKD) is a rare inherited childhood condition where the development of the kidneys and liver is abnormal.
significantLink.name: Autosomal recessive polycystic kidney disease

significantLink.description: Find out more about age-related macular degeneration (AMD), which mainly affects people over 50 years of age and usually leads to a gradual loss of central vision.
significantLink.name: Age-related macular degeneration (AMD)

significantLink.description: Find out about adenomyosis, including symptoms, what to do if you think you have it and how it's treated.
significantLink.name: Adenomyosis

significantLink.description: Find out about atopic eczema, including symptoms, causes and treatments.
significantLink.name: Atopic eczema

significantLink.description: Find out about ADHD (attention deficit hyperactivity disorder) in adults, the symptoms of ADHD, how to get a diagnosis and how to manage it.
significantLink.name: ADHD in adults

significantLink.description: Find out about ADHD (attention deficit hyperactivity disorder) in children and teenagers, the symptoms of ADHD, how to get a diagnosis and how to manage it.
significantLink.name: ADHD in children and young people

significantLink.description: Find out what antisocial personality disorder is, what the signs are, and how it's diagnosed and treated.
significantLink.name: Antisocial personality disorder

significantLink.description: Read about anxiety disorders in children and teenagers, with links to other useful resources.
significantLink.name: Anxiety disorders in children
